Elanor: You were born at the end of a great age, Elanorellë

{{disambig-more: '''Elanor Fairbairn (née Gamgee or Gardner)''' was the first child of Master [[Samwise Gamgee]] and his wife [[Rose Cotton]].
Called "The Fair" for her golden hair, she was born 25 March {{SR
column5: 3021}}), which was at the same time the first day of the [[Fourth Age]] in Gondor. Elanor was also the only one of Samwise's children known to the Ringbearer, [[Frodo Baggins]], and her name was a suggestion by him.<ref name="Havens"/>

Elanor: 1436}} Elanor became a maid of honor to Queen [[Arwen
column5: n}} she married [[Fastred of Greenholm]]. [[Fourth Age 34
column6: Four years later]], Fastred was named [[Warden of Westmarch]] by the [[Thain]] at the request of Samwise. Elanor and her husband then moved to the [[Undertowers]] on the [[Tower Hills]] where their family (becoming known as the [[Fairbairn Family
column7: Fairbairns of the Towers]]) would live for many generations.

{{disambig-more: After her father's passing to the [[Undying Lands]] in {{SR
[[Elanor (disambiguation)]]}}: n}}, Elanor and her line became the keepers of the [[Red Book of Westmarch]]. Her two children were [[Elfstan Fairbairn

{{disambig-more: The name is a reference to the ''[[Elanor (flower)
Elanor: sun-star]]'', a little golden flower blooming in the land of [[Lothlórien]] — this perfectly satisfied Sam's desire for a name that was both [[Elvish]] and yet at the same time a simple flower-name as many hobbit-lasses had.<ref name="Havens">{{RK

{{disambig-more: Besides her presence as an infant in the last chapter of the published ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', and the details noted in the appendices of that book, Elanor's most significant role was in the two versions of the written but unpublished [[The Epilogue
Elanor: epilogue]] of ''The Lord of the Rings''. In that epilogue Elanor talks with her father about the importance of the events that transpired in the story and also about the coming of King [[Aragorn
[[Elanor (disambiguation)]]}}: Elessar]] and Queen Arwen for a visit. Elanor's affectionate name for her father is "Sam-dad", while Sam calls her "''Elanorellë''".<ref name="Epilogue"/>

{{disambig-more: '''1981: [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)
Elanor: ''The Lord of the Rings'' (1981 radio series)]]:'''

{{disambig-more: :Elanor can be heard crying as Frodo ([[Ian Holm]]) tells Sam ([[Bill Nighy]]) that he must go on with his life. The crying is actually by Holm's son, [[Harry Holm
'''2003: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'':'''
:Elanor was played by [[Alexandra Astin]], the daughter of [[Sean Astin]].
'''2010: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: Aragorn's Quest]]'':'''
:Elanor is available as a second player, playing Gandalf to [[Frodo Gardner
Elanor: Frodo]]'s Aragorn. She wears a wizard's hat and a stick to serve as staff.
